name: none
description: This effect is empty. It doesn't even have 'splash' or evolve...

name: change_diplomacy
description: This effect can be used to change the diplomacy stance of the source players with the target player.
It does NOT change the stance both ways.

attributes.name: diplomacy_state
attributes.description: The diplomacy stance to set the stance to.

attributes.name: source_player
attributes.description: The player whose stance will be changed.

attributes.name: target_player
attributes.description: The target player whose diplomacy stance will be changed for the source player.

name: research_technology
description: This effect can be used to automatically research a technology for the specified player.

attributes.name: source_player
attributes.description: The player for whom the technology will be researched.

attributes.name: technology_id
attributes.description: The technology which will be researched for the specified player.

attributes.name: force_technology
attributes.description: When enabled, is used to force the selected technology to be researched, regardless if the civilization has access to it or not.

name: send_chat
description: This effect can be used to send a chat message to the specified player.

attributes.name: source_player
attributes.description: The player who will be receiving the message.

attributes.name: str_id
attributes.description: The string ID which will be used instead of the message.

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: The message to be send to the player.

attributes.name: sound_name
attributes.description: The name of the sound to play when the message is sent.

name: play_sound
description: This effect can be used to play a sound at a specific location or globally for the specified player.

attributes.name: source_player
attributes.description: The player who will hear the sound effect.

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The tile to play the sound at. When not set, the sound will be played globally.

attributes.name: location_object_ref
attributes.description: The unit whose position will be used to play the sound at. When not set, the sound will be played globally.

attributes.name: global_sound
description: When enabled, the sound will be played regardless of if the target is on screen.
This is useful for sounds existing game sound which are considered '3D'.
'3D' sounds are game sounds based on coordinates. '2D' sounds are sounds like GUI, button click or notification sounds.

attributes.name: sound_name
attributes.description: The name of the sound to play

name: tribute
description: This effect can be used to send resources one player to another.

attributes.name: quantity
attributes.description: The amount of the specified resource to send.

attributes.name: resource
attributes.description: The source that will be sent

attributes.name: source_player
attributes.description: The player who will be sending the resource.

attributes.name: target_player
attributes.description: The player who will be receiving the resources

name: unlock_gate
description: This effect can be used to unlock specific gates.

attributes.name: selected_objects
attributes.description: The gates to be unlocked.

name: lock_gate
description: This effect can be used to lock specific gates.

attributes.name: selected_objects
attributes.description: The gates to be locked.

name: activate_trigger
description: This effect can be used to activate a trigger.

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description: The trigger to be activated.

name: deactivate_trigger
description: This effect can be used to deactivate a trigger.

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description: The trigger to be deactivated

name: ai_script_goal
description: This effect can be used to communicate with an AI player by setting an AI Trigger number.
The AI Trigger number can be detected inside an AI script using: `event-detected trigger NUMBER`

attributes.name: ai_script_goal
attributes.description: The AI Trigger number to set

name: create_object
description: This effect can be used to create a unit (including buildings, heroes etc.) for the specified player

attributes.name: object_unit_id
attributes.description: The unit type to be created

attributes.name: source_player
attributes.description: The player whose unit will be created

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The tile where the unit will be created

attributes.name: item_id
attributes.description: A copy of the internal value from the selected unit/technology/resource

attributes.name: facet
attributes.description: The rotation of the created unit in radians

attributes.name: disable_sound
attributes.description: When enabled, disable the sound during the creation of the object

attributes.name: object_unit_id
attributes.description: The unit type to DO|CHANGE THE <ACTION>

attributes.name: source_player
attributes.description: The player whose <ACTION> ((UNITS) ARE AFFECTED)

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The tile to <ACTION>

attributes.name: location_object_ref
attributes.description: The target location referenced by an object

attributes.name: area
attributes.description: The area where units will be <ACTION>. [VERIFY:] When not set, units on the entire map are affected

attributes.name: object_group
attributes.description: The units with this class will be affected by this effect

attributes.name: object_type
attributes.description: The units of this type will be affected by this effect

attributes.name: action_type
attributes.description: The type of action to perform on the affected units

attributes.name: selected_objects
attributes.description: The units to be affected by this effect. When defined, overwrites all other unit filters, like area selection, unit type, object type etc.

attributes.name: disable_garrison_unload_sound
attributes.description: When enabled, disables the sound that happens when unloading garrisoned units

attributes.name: max_units_affected
attributes.description: The maximum number of units affected by this effect

attributes.name: issue_group_command
attributes.description: When enabled, will issue a task as a group formation task, instead of every unit individually

attributes.name: queue_action
attributes.description: When enabled, the set task will be queued

attributes.name: source_player
attributes.description: The player whose <ACTION> ((UNITS) ARE AFFECTED)

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: When enabled, is used to <ACTION>
